intro: Pasania dasystachya, commonly known as the broad-stemmed pasania, is a perennial herb native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests or along stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a notable species in ecological studies and horticultural research.
